section.section:
Of the 9 members of the Commission:
5 shall be licensed real estate brokers, licensed associate real estate brokers, or licensed real estate salespersons; and
4 shall be consumer members.
The Governor shall appoint the members with the advice of the Secretary and with the advice and consent of the Senate.

text.section: Each member of the Commission shall be a citizen of the State.

Each professional member of the Commission shall have been:
a resident of any of the counties in the area from which the member is appointed for at least 5 years immediately before appointment; and
a licensed real estate broker, a licensed associate real estate broker, or a licensed real estate salesperson for at least 10 years immediately before appointment.

section.section:
While a member of the Commission, a consumer member may not:
have a financial interest in or receive compensation from a person regulated by the Commission; or
grade any examination given by or for the Commission.

text.section: Before taking office, each appointee to the Commission shall take the oath required by Article I, § 9 of the Maryland Constitution.

section.section: The term of a member is 4 years and begins on June 1.
The terms of members are staggered as required by the terms provided for members of the Commission on October 1, 1989.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.

text.section: The Governor may remove a member for incompetence or misconduct.
